      • setRestricted

        public void setRestricted(java.lang.String title,
                          java.lang.Object... args)
                   throws IncorrectTypeException
        Sets the argument to only accept a set of restricted values. Multiple values can be added(separated by a comma).
        Parameters:
        title - The name of the argument
        args - The value(s) the argument is restricted to
        Throws:
        IncorrectTypeException - If an incorrect data type is entered for the argument

      • checkRestricted

        public java.lang.String checkRestricted(java.lang.String title)
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the argument
        Returns:
        the values the argument is restricted to

      • setValue

        public void setValue(java.lang.String... args)
              throws IncorrectTypeException,
                     IncorrectValueException
        Parameters:
        args - the value(s) of the referenced optional argument or the next positional argument
        Throws:
        IncorrectTypeException - if the data type does not match the data type of the argument
        IncorrectValueException - if the value does not match the restricted values

      • parse

        public void parse(java.lang.String str)
           throws NotEnoughArgValuesException,
                  TooManyArgValuesException,
                  IncorrectTypeException,
                  IncorrectValueException
        Parameters:
        str - the string to be parsed
        Throws:
        NotEnoughArgValuesException - if the amount of values parsed does not match the number of required arguments
        TooManyArgValuesException - if the amount of values parsed exceeds the number of required arguments
        IncorrectTypeException - if the data type of a value does not match the data type of the argument
        IncorrectValueException - if the value does not match the restricted values of an argument

      • getNextArgumentNumberValues

        public int getNextArgumentNumberValues()

      • getHelpText

        public java.lang.String getHelpText()
        Returns:
        the formatted help text of the program and arguments

      • getOutput

        public java.lang.String getOutput()
        Returns:
        the XML notation of the argument list

      • writeToXMLFile

        public void writeToXMLFile(java.lang.String filename)
        Takes the information of the arguments and optional arguments - title, description, number of values, and the data type - and writes it to an XML file. Automatically generates the XML tags appropriate for each piece of data.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file to write the XML code to
